name: Disney in the 70s Quiz | Movie Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of these was NOT a part of the Kurt Russell teenager-turned-superstar trilogy?
options: The Strongest Man in the World
Now You See Him, Now You Don't
questions.explanation:
The Barefoot Executive.

	"The Barefoot Executive" did feature Kurt Russell but was not one of the films in which he played a high school senior who develops some formula that makes him in some way more than human.

questions.text: Who starred in the most Disney comedies from the late 60's to late 70's?
questions.explanation:
Dean Jones.

	Aside from Fred MacMurray, Dean Jones was Disney's favorite leading man. His everyman charm and incredulous "what's going on" stare made him perfect for films like "The Ugly Dacshund" and "Blackbeard's Ghost".

questions.text: What film featured Jodie Foster trying to solve a mystery and dealing with David Niven as a devoted butler who keeps his employer Helen Hayes happy by pretending to also be the gardener and a host of other characters?
questions.explanation:
Candleshoe.

	When I was growing up, if you told anyone that Jodie Foster would grow up to be one of the screen's most important modern actresses with two Oscars under her belt, they would have laughed at you silly.

questions.text: Which film did NOT feature Peter Ustinov?
options: One of Our Dinosaurs is Missing
questions.explanation:
The Wild Country.

	The best of these is "Blackbeard's Ghost". A real treasure!

questions.text: Which of these films featured the political war between supporters of Benjamin Harrison and Grover Cleveland for the presidency?
questions.correct: One and Only, Genuine, Original Family Band
questions.explanation:
One and Only, Genuine, Original Family Band.

	This was an election even closer than the Bush-Gore election, with Harrison winning by electoral votes.

questions.text: Which of these films did not spawn a sequel?
questions.explanation:
Condorman.

	"The Love Bug" spawned 3 sequels, "The Apple Dumpling Gang" spawned 1 plus a tv movie, and "The Shaggy Dog" lead to "The Shaggy D.A."

questions.text: Which of these animated films was NOT made during the 70's?
questions.explanation:
The Story of Robin Hood.

	Trick question. Though "Robin Hood" the animated feature was made in the 70's, "The Story of Robin Hood" was a Disney live-action feature made in the 50's.

questions.text: Which film featured a gang of church ladies and a priest acting as crimefighters to save their parish?
questions.explanation:
The North Avenue Irregulars.

	An overlooked comedy. Really a charming film for the whole family.

questions.text: Which film did the Sherman Brothers NOT compose songs for?
questions.explanation:
Pete's Dragon.

	The Sherman Brothers wrote some of the songs for "Robin Hood" along with Roger Miller. The songs for "Pete's Dragon" were composed by Al Kasha and Jerome Courtland.

questions.correct: The spell used to repel the Nazis in "Bedknobs and Broomsticks"
options: The magic that brings Herbie the Love Bug to life
The invisibility formula in "Now You See Him, Now You Don't"
The magic that makes the cat float in "Cat From Outer Space"
questions.explanation:
The spell used to repel the Nazis in "Bedknobs and Broomsticks".

	The best Disney film of the decade. First movie I ever saw.
